content: chick page 1 page 2 page 4 setup pattern techniques what you need and what you need the instructions to make your very step-by-step photo tutorials for the to know to get started own chick techniques used in this pattern you can also find these tutorials plus more tips at thewoobles com/tutorials thewoobles com © 2019 the woobles all rights reserved 1 setup materials 1 4mm crochet hook 2 stitch marker 6 2 4 3 tapestry needle 8 4 8mm safety eyes 5 poly-fil stuffing 6 orange aran-weight yarn 1 yd 3 7 yellow aran-weight yarn 25 yds 1 5 7 8 scissors not included abbreviations find tutorials for anything underlined at thewoobles com/tutorials this pattern is written in us terminology and crocheted in the round chain chain single_crochet single_crochet increase 2 single_crochet in the same stitch of the previous round decrease invisible decrease round total number of stitches in the round how to read the pattern round 3 single_crochet increase x 4 12 what stitches to do this round and how many times for round 3 repeat the pattern in the brackets 4 times the pattern is single crochet in 1 stitch then increase stitch in the next stitch because an increase is actually 2 single_crochet stitches in the same stitch of the previous round the total number of stitches in this round is 12 thewoobles com © 2019 the woobles all rights reserved 2 pattern head & body round 1 6 single_crochet in magic loop 6 yellow yarn to keep track of where you are use a stitch marker to mark the beginning of each round each time you start a new round move the stitch marker to the first stitch of that round round 2 increase x 6 12 round 3 single_crochet increase x 6 18 round 4 increase 2 single_crochet x 6 24 round 5 24 single_crochet 24 your work might start curling at this point for a neater final look push the middle of your circle until it curves the other way this makes the right side face out then keep on crocheting in the same direction as you were round 6 5 single_crochet increase x 4 28 round 7-9 28 single_crochet 28 round 10 6 single_crochet increase x 4 32 round 11-12 32 single_crochet 32 round 13 2 single_crochet decrease x 8 24 round 14 24 single_crochet 24 round 15 single_crochet decrease x 8 16 round 16 16 single_crochet 16 insert the safety eyes between rounds 8 & 9 with 6 stitches between them if this toy is for a baby or pet embroider the eyes instead stuff your piece shaping it like an egg round 17 decrease x 8 8 fasten_off with a long tail to close the remaining gap follow the finish a closed piece instruction in techniques beak round 1 4 single_crochet in magic loop 4 orange yarn round 2 single_crochet increase x 2 6 fasten_off with a long tail fold the beak in half lengthwise attach the beak at round
